snippet: Senator Barbara A. Mikulski, chairwoman of the Senate Appropriations Committee, is charged with heading off what could be the first shutdown of Washington after three years of near misses.
abstract: Senator Barbara A Mikulski, Maryland Democrat and chairwoman of the Senate Appropriations Committee, is charged with heading off what could be the first shutdown of Washington after three years of near misses;  she is longest serving woman in Congress, first female leader of its most august committee and fulcrum in fiscal fight that will dominate Washington in fall; question is whether she can forge an agreement among the Senate, House Republicans and the White House.
lead_paragraph: Senator Barbara A. Mikulski, chairwoman of the Senate Appropriations Committee, is charged with heading off what could be the first shutdown of Washington after three years of near misses.

headline.main: Senator Amplifies Her Voice to Referee Fiscal Showdown
headline.print_headline: Senator Amplifies Her Voice To Referee Fiscal Showdown
